text: Chionodes fructuaria is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Alberta, California, Arizona, Wyoming, Utah, Idaho, Colorado, Nevada, New Mexico, Texas and Florida.Chionodes at funetmothphotographersgroup The wingspan is 13–15 mm. The forewings are dark brown or blackish, with a sprinkling of paler scales in the apex. The markings are pale yellow or whitish. The hindwings are pale grey, shading to darker outwardly.Trans. Am. Ent. Soc. 51 (3) : 193 The larvae feed on Atriplex confertifolia. ==References== Category:Chionodes Category:Moths described in 1935 Category:Moths of North America
title: Chionodes fructuaria
